newsitem.title: USA: Total World Telecommunications sued by investor.
newsitem.headline: Total World Telecommunications sued by investor.

text.p: Total World Telecommunications Inc was sued Tuesday by Banque Franck SA of Switzerland, agent for Kingsbridge Capital of Ireland.

In papers filed in the U.S. District Court in Delaware, the bank said "Total World has refused to convert any part of Kingsbridge Capital's shares of Total World Series B Preferred Stock to shares of Total World common stock pursuant to the notices of conversion."
The bank said Kingsbridge Capital paid $350,000 for 3,500 shares of Total World preferred convertible to common stock or cash.

Separately, on Monday Total World said the Nasdaq stock exchange had suspended trading of Total World stock pending the company's release of financial information related to a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing Monday by a subsidiary, Total National Telecommunications Inc on Monday.

Banque Franck and Kingsbridge have asked the court either to compel the conversion of the preferred stock or to award them $869,591 in damages. An award of $1 million in punitive damages is also sought.
A spokesman at Total World could not be reached for comment.
